doctor-letter.decision.q1.label: Is a complete ME/CFS presentation present?
doctor-letter.decision.q1.help: At minimum, the Institute of Medicine (IOM) criteria or the Canadian Consensus Criteria (CCC, incl. PEM/PENE) must be met.
doctor-letter.infobox.q1:
Both the CCC and IOM criteria are recommended for practice within the G-BA care guideline and the AWMF guideline "Fatigue"
(Chapter 5.7 ME/CFS). **[Source: German Society for ME/CFS](https://praxisleitfaden.mecfs.de/mecfs)**

Alternatively, the questionnaire **["Do I have ME" by the Swiss Society for ME & CFS](https://sgme.ch/icc)** helps determine whether a complete ME presentation according to the International Consensus Criteria (ICC) is present.

doctor-letter.decision.q3.label: Did ME/CFS develop after an infection?
doctor-letter.decision.q3.help: Select yes only if it was a classic infection; if no, you can choose another cause (e.g. vaccination or medication).

doctor-letter.decision.q5.label: Select another cause
doctor-letter.decision.q6.label: Is chronic fatigue present?
doctor-letter.decision.q6.help: Chronic fatigue (also referred to as 'chronic tiredness')?
doctor-letter.decision.q7.label: Is PEM or PENE present?
doctor-letter.decision.q7.help:
PEM: Post-exertional malaise, PENE: Post-Exertional Neuroimmune Exhaustion
A delayed, severe worsening of condition after minor exertion.
doctor-letter.decision.q8.label: Select a cause
doctor-letter.decision.q8.help: Select a cause here that could be responsible for chronic fatigue and PEM (unknown cause, EBV, influenza, COVID-19 infection, COVID-19 vaccination, other cause).
Interim result - complete your details below and generate your letter.
doctor-letter.case.0.paragraph: [[P]] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [[P]] !!! IMPORTANT NOTICE !!! [[P]] UNFORTUNATELY, based on your answers, we CANNOT CREATE a complete LETTER here. [[P]] This letter generator is intended only for people who: [[P]] meet a complete ME/CFS presentation according to IOM or CCC criteria (incl. PEM, at least 6 months) OR have chronic fatigue WITH post-exertional malaise (PEM). [[P]] What you can do now: [[P]] 1. If you are unsure about ME/CFS: [[P]] Fill out the questionnaire by the Swiss Society for ME & CFS "Do I have ME?": https://sgme.ch/icc [[P]] 2. If you are unsure about PEM: [[P]] Learn about the definition of post-exertional malaise: www.mecfs.de/pem [[P]] 3. Discuss with your doctor which (other) diagnoses could be considered for your symptoms. [[P]] !!! IMPORTANT NOTICE !!! [[P]] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
doctor-letter.case.1.paragraph: Since I meet the full Canadian Consensus Criteria (CCC) - including post-exertional malaise (PEM) - and my symptoms for more than 6 months are sequelae of infectious mononucleosis due to Epstein–Barr virus, the new correct codes are: [[P]] + G93.30 (Myalgic encephalomyelitis, post-infectious) [[BR]]+ B94.81 (Sequelae of (infectious) mononucleosis due to Epstein–Barr virus)
doctor-letter.case.2.paragraph: Since I meet the full Canadian Consensus Criteria (CCC) - including post-exertional malaise (PEM) - and my symptoms for more than 6 months are sequelae of influenza, the new correct codes are: [[P]] + G93.30 (Myalgic encephalomyelitis, post-infectious) [[BR]]+ B94.80 (Sequelae of influenza)
doctor-letter.case.3.paragraph: Since I meet the full Canadian Consensus Criteria (CCC) - including post-exertional malaise (PEM) - and my symptoms for more than 6 months are sequelae following COVID-19, the new correct codes are: [[P]] + G93.30 (Myalgic encephalomyelitis, post-infectious) [[BR]]+ U09.9! (Post-COVID-19 condition, unspecified)
doctor-letter.case.4.paragraph: Since I meet the full Canadian Consensus Criteria (CCC) - including post-exertional malaise (PEM) - and my symptoms for more than 6 months are sequelae of a COVID-19 vaccination, the new correct codes are: [[P]] + G93.31 (Myalgic encephalomyelitis, not post-infectious) [[BR]]+ U12.9! (Adverse effects in the use of COVID-19 vaccines)
doctor-letter.case.5.paragraph: Since I have developed chronic fatigue with post-exertional malaise (PEM) and these symptoms are sequelae of infectious mononucleosis due to Epstein–Barr virus, the new correct codes are: [[P]] +B94.81 (Sequelae of mononucleosis due to Epstein–Barr virus) [[BR]]+R53.0 (Chronic fatigue with post-exertional malaise [PEM]) [[P]] The code B94.81 was introduced for the first time in this form and now allows the specific documentation of sequelae after EBV. [[P]] Important note on PEM: With post-exertional malaise, physical activation is contraindicated because it leads to long-term worsening. Instead, pacing (energy management) is required. Activation therapies such as graded exercise therapy (GET) are not indicated according to the NICE guideline (2021). (Source: German Society for ME/CFS) [[P]] I would ask you to observe together with me whether a complete ME/CFS presentation develops from this. As soon as the Institute of Medicine (IOM) criteria or the Canadian Consensus Criteria (CCC) are met, G93.30 should be coded instead of R53.0. Even before the 6-month period is reached, G93.30 V (suspected post-infectious myalgic encephalomyelitis) can be coded if there is justified suspicion.

doctor-letter.case.9.paragraph: Since I meet the full Canadian Consensus Criteria (CCC) - including post-exertional malaise (PEM) - and my symptoms for more than 6 months are sequelae of [insert infection type here], the new correct codes are: [[P]] + G93.30 (Myalgic encephalomyelitis, post-infectious) [[BR]]+ [INSERT THE APPROPRIATE ICD-10 CODE FOR THE SPECIFIC INFECTION HERE]
doctor-letter.case.10.paragraph: Since I meet the full Canadian Consensus Criteria (CCC) - including post-exertional malaise (PEM) - and my symptoms have persisted for more than 6 months, but a known non-infectious cause is present, the new correct codes are: [[P]] + G93.31 (Myalgic encephalomyelitis, not post-infectious) [[BR]]+ [insert the appropriate code for the specific non-infectious cause here]
doctor-letter.case.11.paragraph: Since I meet the full Canadian Consensus Criteria (CCC) - including post-exertional malaise (PEM) - and my symptoms have persisted for more than 6 months, but the cause could not be clearly determined, the new correct coding is: [[P]] + G93.39 (Myalgic encephalomyelitis, unspecified)
doctor-letter.case.12.paragraph: Since I have developed chronic fatigue with post-exertional malaise (PEM) and the cause has not yet been clearly determined, the new correct coding is: [[P]] + R53.0 (Chronic fatigue with post-exertional malaise [PEM]) [[P]] Important note on PEM: With post-exertional malaise, physical activation is contraindicated because it leads to long-term worsening.
